intro: Calceolaria bridgesii, commonly known as the Andean slipper orchid, is a striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that resemble tiny cups. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its vibrant colors, often in shades of red, orange, and yellow, make it a visually appealing species. Calceolaria bridgesii is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in its native habitat.
